metadata.title: CVE-2018-17182 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - high
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel through 4.18.8. Thevmacache_flush_all function in mm/vmacache.c mishandles sequence numberoverflows. An attacker can trigger a use-after-free (and possibly gainprivileges) via certain thread creation, map, unmap, invalidation, anddereference operations.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-17182` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic-64k - 6.8.0-31.31
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1008-aws - 6.8.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-azure - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-gcp - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency - 6.8.0-31.31.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency-64k - 6.8.0-31.31.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle - 6.8.0-1005.5

No subscription required
